title: Antucura 2013 Intuition Malbec (Vista Flores)
description: Cherry and berry aromas open this slick feeling Malbec. Sweet berry flavors are ripe, candied and medicinal. A candied flavor carries onto the finish, which darkens a bit at the end.

title: Château Réal Martin 2015 Perle du Rosé Rosé (Côtes de Provence)
description: The name is spot-on for a wine with a pink-pearl color. It is gently fruity with soft red fruits and a touch of pepper. The aftertaste is crisp, clean and refreshing.

title: Confidence 2013 Eloquent Grenache-Syrah-Mourvèdre Red (Vin de France)
description: Fruity scents of cherry, cranberry, red currant and plum are hit with good doses of menthol and licorice on the nose of this Rhône-style blend. The medium tannins are fine yet fleeting, lending only a subtle structure to the direct plum and cherry flavors.

title: Corner 103 2012 Red (Sonoma County)
description: This is a blend of Merlot, Syrah, Zinfandel and Petite Sirah that shows the Merlot's clove and red currant characteristics upfront, with a ripe, soft, seamless palate that isn't otherwise sure what it wants to say.

title: Domaine de Paris 2015 Rosé (Côtes de Provence)
description: This is a pretty, light and balanced wine. It has attractive acidity plus a crisp edge of grapefruit and a typical touch of spice to give it a lift and an edge. The aftertaste continues the attractive, fresh theme.

title: Château Cavalier 2015 Rosé (Côtes de Provence)
description: Owned by the Bordeaux Castel family, this estate has produced a simple, light wine packed with fruit. It's light and bright, with just a hint of earthiness that takes away from the freshness. The aftertaste adds lemon crispness.

title: Château Gairoird 2015 Donum Coeli Rosé (Côtes de Provence)
description: A pale-colored blend of Grenache, Syrah and Cinsault, this light and fruity wine is made from organic grapes. It is refreshing, bright and immediately accessible with its gentle texture, making it a fine summer apéritif.

title: Broglia 2013 Bruno Broglia del Comune di Gavi  (Gavi)
description: This opens with aromas that recall spring flower, citrus and a whiff of honeydew melon. The rather lean, linear palate shows grapefruit and flint alongside racy acidity. A bitter almond note signals the finish.
designation: Bruno Broglia del Comune di Gavi

title: Brotte 2015 Charles Brotte Cuvée Rose Secret Rosé (Vin de France)
description: With the typical blend of a Côtes de Provence rosé, this is pale in color and light at heart. Made by the well-known Châteauneuf-du-Pape producer, it has some weight as well as ripe red fruits. A touch of tannin in the structure gives it an attractive tension as well as a tangy aftertaste.

title: CarlindePaolo 2015 Arneis (Terre Alfieri)
description: The nose is rather shy but eventually reveals whiffs of spring wild flower and beeswax. The straightforward palate offers pear, citrus, mineral and a hint of almond alongside rather fresh acidity.

title: St. Francis 2013 Reserve Merlot (Sonoma Valley)
description: This wine presents itself full-bodied and big in style, with an inkling of red plum and cherry fighting for attention against a tide of rounded concentration and darker, smokier tinges of cigar and chocolate.

title: Tenuta dell'Ugolino 2015 Le Piaole  (Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi Classico)
description: This fresh white has delicate aromas of white spring flower and yellow stone fruit. The bright, easygoing palate offers yellow peach, bitter almond and a light saline note alongside bright acidity. It's simple but well made.
region_1: Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi Classico

title: Kohl 2015 Gelber Muskateller (Niederösterreich)
description: Tender notes of elderflower fill the nose with an almost confected note. The palate is fresh, crisp and clean with the same aromatic swing. A summer wine to be drunk as soon as possible for fragrant refreshment.

title: Lionel Osmin & Cie 2015 Villa Grand Cap White (Vin de France)
description: A true wine from southwest France, this brings together grapes from Gascony and Gaillac. It is delicate and fruity. The freshest green-fruit flavors come together with intense acidity and a tang that is poised and crisp.

title: Fabre en Provence 2015 Château de la Deidière Rosé (Côtes de Provence)
description: From one of the four properties bought by great-grandparents of the present owner, this wine is light, bright and totally up-to-the-minute in its crisp freshness. Red fruits and touches of citrus dominate along with the lightest touch of tannin. It will make a great apéritif.

title: Malabaila 2014 Pradvaj  (Roero)
description: Subdued aromas of pear and white spring flower lift out of the glass. The lean palate offers grapefruit, pear bitter almond and mineral alongside tangy acidity.

title: Malvirà 2014 Non Filtrato  (Roero)
description: Lime blossom, bread crust and a whiff of toast lead the nose. Slightly fizzy when first poured, the lively palate offers citrus, green Anjou pear and bitter nut while a hint of flinty mineral closes the finish.

title: Marchesi di Barolo 2015 del Comune di Gavi  (Gavi)
description: The nose isn't very expressive but eventually reveals whiffs of pressed white flower and orchard fruit. The straightforward palate offers suggestions of mature yellow apple, candied lemon drop and a bitter almond note.

title: Martellotto 2014 La Bomba Cabernet Sauvignon (Happy Canyon of Santa Barbara)
description: Caramelized meats, dark cherry fruits, tar and pencil lead elements emerge on the nose of this bottling. The flavors are reminiscent of charred beef, with charcoal, turned earth and dark chocolate set against dried blueberry background.

title: Matchbook 2012 Tinto Rey Red (Dunnigan Hills)
description: Aromas like plums and flavors like prunes give a ripe character to this medium-bodied and smooth-textured wine. It has good balance due to firm tannins and light acidity, so it doesn't get tiring on the third or fourth sip.

title: Matrix 2013 Forchini Old Vine Zinfandel (Russian River Valley)
description: Coconut macaroon and smoky leather stand out most in this burly, bombastic and beyond full-bodied wine, which drinks ripe and hot.

title: Filón 2013 Filón Real Garnacha (Calatayud)
description: Horseradish and berry aromas are a touch rough and tough. This tannic Garnacha features a pinched, hard mouthfeel and tight, drawing flavors of berry fruits and plum. Peppery harshness and rubbery tannins define the finish.

title: Five Rows 2014 Marmont Vineyards Chardonnay (Lodi)
description: This wine has an unusually rich gold color, aromas like ripe pear, vanilla and nutmeg, and similar pastry and baking spice flavors plus that core of pear. A creamy texture and soft finish round it out nicely.

title: Fjord 2014 Sauvignon Blanc (North Fork of Long Island)
description: Dusty bramble aromas outshine delicate blossom notes on this zesty medium-bodied Sauvignon Blanc. White grapefruit and herb tones brighten the midpalate. While not persistent, its brisk finish is refreshing.

title: Hillinger 2014 Blaufränkisch (Burgenland)
description: Juicy black cherry is the main theme here: it fills nose and palate. The body lacks a little focus but its fleshiness is cut by freshness that sets all the cherry fruit into scene.

title: Hunt Cellars 2010 Cloud 9 Destiny Vineyards Cabernet Sauvignon (Paso Robles)
description: Smashed blueberries, cracked peppercorns and pressed purple flowers show on the nose of this bottling. The palate is sour-leaning with dried plum and pine needle flavors, held together by sticky tannins that are mouth-coating and a bit tense.

title: Dunham 2014 Four Legged White (Washington)
description: Somewhat subdued white flower, lime and peach aromas are followed by medium-sweet stone-fruit flavors. It goes down easy.

title: El Porvenir 2015 Amauta Absoluto Torrontés (Cafayate)
description: Melony aromas and a simple mouthfeel render this an enjoyable Torrontés. Melon, apricot and lychee flavors all fit the bill, while the palate is round and viscous. Drink now.

title: Fattoria Coroncino 2015 Il Bacco  (Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi Classico Superiore)
description: Deeply colored gold, this opens with scents suggesting dried chamomile flower and toasted walnut. The palate is evolved, offering grapefruit and bitter almond alongside racy acidity. Drink soon to capture the remaining fruit.
region_1: Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi Classico Superiore

title: Fattoria La Vialla 2014  Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi Classico Superiore
description: The nose is rather shy but eventually reveals aromas suggesting nut and acacia honey. The lean palate shows unripe pear, lime, saline and a hint of bitter nut alongside brisk acidity.
region_1: Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi Classico Superiore
